title: Nimodipine (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Nimodipine (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Nimotop
2.  Nymalize

【4】### Descriptions

【5】  

【6】Nimodipine is used to treat symptoms resulting from a ruptured blood vessel in the brain (subarachnoid hemorrhage). It works by increasing the blood flow to injured brain tissue.

【7】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【8】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【9】*   Capsule, Liquid Filled
*   Solution

【10】Before Using
------------

【11】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【12】### Allergies

【13】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【14】### Pediatric

【15】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of nimodipine in the pediatric population. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【16】### Geriatric

【17】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of nimodipine in the elderly. However, elderly patients are more likely to have age-related kidney, liver, or heart problems, which may require caution in patients receiving nimodipine.

【18】### Breastfeeding

【19】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【20】### Drug Interactions

【21】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【22】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【23】*   Boceprevir
*   Clarithromycin
*   Conivaptan
*   Delavirdine
*   Indinavir
*   Ketoconazole
*   Lopinavir
*   Nefazodone
*   Nelfinavir
*   Posaconazole
*   Ritonavir
*   Saquinavir
*   Telaprevir
*   Telithromycin
*   Voriconazole

【24】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【25】*   Carbamazepine
*   Ceritinib
*   Clopidogrel
*   Cobicistat
*   Dantrolene
*   Darunavir
*   Dexamethasone
*   Digoxin
*   Epirubicin
*   Fosphenytoin
*   Itraconazole
*   Lacosamide
*   Phenobarbital
*   Phenytoin
*   Rifampin
*   Rifapentine
*   St John's Wort

【26】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines may cause an increased risk of certain side effects, but using both drugs may be the best treatment for you. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【27】*   Dalfopristin
*   Quinupristin
*   Valproic Acid

【28】### Other Interactions

【29】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【30】Using this medicine with any of the following is usually not recommended, but may be unavoidable in some cases. If used together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use this medicine, or give you special instructions about the use of food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【31】*   Grapefruit Juice

【32】### Other Medical Problems

【33】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【34】*   Liver disease (including cirrhosis)—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of the medicine from the body.

【35】Proper Use
----------

【36】Take this medicine exactly as directed even if you feel well and do not notice any symptoms. Do not take more of this medicine and do not take it more often than your doctor ordered. Do not miss any doses.

【37】This medicine is usually given within 96 hours of having the condition. It is best to take this medicine at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after a meal.

【38】If the capsule cannot be swallowed or if you are using this medicine with a nasogastric tube (NGT), you may put a hole in both ends of the capsule and remove its contents using a syringe. Use the syringe to give the medicine orally or through the NGT. Do not use it to give the medicine as an injection through the veins, muscles, or skin.

【39】If you are using the oral liquid:

【40】*   Measure your dose with a marked measuring spoon, oral syringe, or medicine cup.
*   If the medicine is going to be given through a nasogastric or gastric tube, use the oral syringe that comes with the package to measure the dose. For each dose, refill the syringe with saline solution to flush any remaining medicine in the nasogastric tube into the stomach.

【41】Do not eat grapefruit or drink grapefruit juice while you are using this medicine.

【42】### Dosing

【43】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【44】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【45】*   For subarachnoid hemorrhage:
    *   For oral dosage form (capsules):
        *   Adults—60 milligrams (mg) or two 30 mg capsules every 4 hours for 21 days.
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.
    *   For oral dosage form (solution):
        *   Adults—20 milliliters (mL) (60 milligrams \[mg\]) every 4 hours for 21 consecutive days.
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.

【46】### Missed Dose

【47】If you miss a dose of this medicine, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【48】### Storage

【49】Keep out of the reach of children.

【50】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【51】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【52】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【53】Do not refrigerate the oral liquid.

【54】Precautions
-----------

【55】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits to make sure this medicine is working properly and to check for unwanted effects.

【56】You will need to have your blood pressure measured during treatment with this medicine. If you notice any changes to your recommended blood pressure, call your doctor right away. If you have questions about this, talk to your doctor.

【57】Dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting may also occur while using this medicine. Make sure you know how you react to this medicine before you drive, use machines, or do anything else that could be dangerous if you are dizzy or not alert. If you feel dizzy, lie down so you do not faint. Then sit for a few moments before standing to prevent the dizziness from returning.

【58】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal (eg, St John's wort) or vitamin supplements.

【59】Side Effects
------------

【60】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【61】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【62】#### Less common

【63】1.  Blurred vision
2.  chest pain or discomfort
3.  confusion
4.  difficult or labored breathing
5.  fast, pounding, or irregular heartbeat or pulse
6.  lightheadedness, dizziness, or fainting
7.  shortness of breath
8.  slow or irregular heartbeat
9.  sweating
10.  swelling
11.  tightness in the chest
12.  unusual tiredness or weakness

【64】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【65】#### Less common

【66】1.  Abdominal or stomach cramps, discomfort, or pain
2.  back pain
3.  blemishes on the skin
4.  constipation
5.  diarrhea
6.  discouragement
7.  feeling sad or empty
8.  headache
9.  indigestion
10.  irritability
11.  lack or loss of appetite
12.  loss of interest or pleasure
13.  muscle pain
14.  nausea or vomiting
15.  pimples
16.  rash
17.  swollen mouth and tongue
18.  tiredness
19.  trouble concentrating
20.  trouble sleeping
21.  unpleasant taste
22.  urge to have bowel movement

【67】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【68】Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

【69】Portions of this document last updated: Aug. 01, 2023

【70】Original article: https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements/nimodipine-oral-route/description/drg-20071709

title: Ibuprofen And Famotidine (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Ibuprofen And Famotidine (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Duexis

【4】### Descriptions

【5】  

【6】Ibuprofen and famotidine combination is used to relieve the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis. It is used for patients who have an increased risk for stomach ulcers and who need to take a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) for arthritis.

【7】Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that is used to treat pain, inflammation, swelling, stiffness, and joint pain. Famotidine is a histamine H2-receptor antagonist or H2-blocker. It works by decreasing the amount of acid produced by the stomach.

【8】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【9】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【10】*   Tablet

【11】Before Using
------------

【12】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【13】### Allergies

【14】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【15】### Pediatric

【16】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of ibuprofen and famotidine combination in the pediatric population. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【17】### Geriatric

【18】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of ibuprofen and famotidine combination in the elderly. However, elderly patients are more likely to have age-related heart, stomach, or kidney problems, which may require caution and an adjustment in the dose for patients receiving this medicine.

【19】### Breastfeeding

*   Ulcerative colitis, history of—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【36】*   Aspirin-sensitive asthma or
*   Aspirin sensitivity, history of or
*   Kidney disease, severe—Should not be used in patients with these conditions.

【37】*   Dehydration or
*   Hypovolemia—Must be corrected first before using this medicine.

【38】*   Heart surgery (eg, coronary artery bypass graft \[CABG\])—Should not be used to relieve pain right before or after the surgery.

【39】*   Kidney disease—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of famotidine from the body.

【40】Proper Use
----------

【41】Use this medicine exactly as ordered by your doctor. Do not use more of it, do not use it more often, and do not use it for a longer time than ordered by your doctor. To do so may increase the chance of unwanted effects, especially in elderly patients.

【42】This medicine comes with a Medication Guide. Read and follow these instructions carefully. Ask your doctor or pharmacist if you have any questions.

【43】Swallow the tablet whole. Do not break, crush, divide, or chew it.

【44】This medicine contains ibuprofen. Do not take this medicine with other products containing ibuprofen.

【45】Do not substitute this medicine with single-ingredient products of ibuprofen and famotidine. Use only the brand of this medicine that your doctor prescribed. Different brands may not work the same way.

【46】### Dosing

【47】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【48】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【49】*   For oral dosage form (tablets):
    *   For rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis:
        *   Adults—1 tablet (800 milligrams (mg) ibuprofen and 26.6 mg famotidine) 3 times a day.
        *   Children—Use and dose must be determined by your doctor.

【50】### Missed Dose

【51】If you miss a dose of this medicine, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【52】### Storage

【53】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【54】Keep out of the reach of children.

【55】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【56】Ask your healthcare professional how you should dispose of any medicine you do not use.

【57】Precautions
-----------

【58】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits while you are using this medicine. This will allow your doctor to see if the medicine is working properly and to decide if you should continue to use it. Blood and urine tests may be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【59】Ibuprofen may increase your risk of having a heart attack or stroke. This is more likely in people who already have heart disease. People who use this medicine for a long time might also have a higher risk. Check with your doctor right away if you are having chest pain or discomfort, nausea or vomiting, pain or discomfort in the arms, jaw, back, or neck, trouble breathing, slurred speech, or weakness.

【60】Ibuprofen may cause bleeding in your stomach or intestines. This problem can happen without warning signs. This is more likely if you have had a stomach ulcer in the past, if you smoke or drink alcohol regularly, if you are over 60 years of age, are in poor health, or are using certain other medicines (eg, steroids or a blood thinner).

【61】Check with your doctor right away if you have pain or tenderness in the upper stomach, pale stools, dark urine, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, or yellow eyes or skin. These could be symptoms of a serious liver problem.

【62】Your blood pressure might get too high while you are using this medicine. This may cause headaches, dizziness, or blurred vision. You might need to measure your blood pressure at home. If you think your blood pressure is too high, call your doctor right away.

【63】If you are rapidly gaining weight, trouble breathing, chest pain or discomfort, extreme tiredness or weakness, irregular breathing, irregular heartbeat, or excessive swelling of the hands, wrist, ankles, or feet, check with your doctor immediately. These may be symptoms of heart problems or your body keeping too much water.

【64】Check with your doctor right away if you have blood in the urine, decrease in the frequency or amount of urine, an increase in blood pressure, increased thirst, loss of appetite, lower back or side pain, nausea, swelling of the face, fingers, or lower legs, trouble breathing, unusual tiredness or weakness, vomiting, or weight gain. These may be symptoms of a serious kidney problem.

【65】Hyperkalemia (high potassium in the blood) may occur while you are using this medicine. Check with your doctor right away if you have stomach pain, confusion, difficulty with breathing, irregular heartbeat, nausea or vomiting, nervousness, numbness or tingling in the hands, feet, or lips, or weakness or heaviness of the legs.

【66】This medicine may cause a serious allergic reaction called anaphylaxis, which can be life-threatening and requires immediate medical attention. Call your doctor right away if you have a rash, itching, hoarseness, trouble breathing, trouble swallowing, or any swelling of your hands, face, or mouth while you are using this medicine.

【67】Serious skin reactions, including exfoliative dermatitis, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, and drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS) can occur with this medicine. Check with your doctor right away if you have black, tarry stools, blistering, peeling, or loosening of the skin, chest pain, chills, cough, fever, painful or difficult urination, red irritated eyes, red skin lesions, often with a purple center, sore throat, sores, ulcers, or white spots on the lips or in the mouth, swollen glands, unusual bleeding or bruising, or unusual tiredness and weakness.

【68】Using this medicine during the later part of pregnancy can harm your unborn baby. If you think you have become pregnant while using this medicine, tell your doctor right away.

【69】This medicine may cause a delay in ovulation for women and may affect their ability to have children. If you plan to have children, talk with your doctor before using this medicine.

【70】Some people who have used this medicine had symptoms of meningitis. If you have fever, headache, nausea, vomiting, and stiff neck or back while using this medicine, check with your doctor right away.

【71】Check with your doctor right away if blurred vision, difficulty with reading, or any other change in vision occurs during or after your treatment. Your doctor may want your eyes be checked by an ophthalmologist (eye doctor).

【72】Before having any kind of surgery or medical tests, tell your doctor that you are using this medicine. It may be necessary for you to stop the medicine for a while, or to change to a different medicine before your procedure.

【73】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or nonprescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【74】Side Effects
------------

【75】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【76】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【77】#### Less common

【78】1.  Bladder pain
2.  bloating or swelling of the face, arms, hands, lower legs, or feet
3.  bloody or black, tarry stools
4.  blurred vision
5.  chills
6.  clay-colored stools
7.  cloudy urine
8.  constipation
9.  cough
10.  dark-colored urine
11.  diarrhea
12.  difficult, burning, or painful urination
13.  dizziness
14.  fever
15.  frequent urge to urinate
16.  general feeling of discomfort or illness
17.  headache
18.  heartburn
19.  indigestion
20.  itching or rash
21.  joint pain
22.  light-colored stools
23.  loss of appetite
24.  lower back or side pain
25.  muscle aches and pains
26.  nausea
27.  nervousness
28.  pale skin
29.  pounding in the ears
30.  rapid weight gain
31.  runny nose
32.  severe stomach pain
33.  shivering
34.  slow or fast heartbeat
35.  sore throat
36.  stomach pain, cramping, or burning
37.  sweating
38.  tingling of the hands or feet
39.  trouble sleeping
40.  trouble breathing
41.  unpleasant breath odor
42.  unusual bleeding or bruising
43.  unusual tiredness or weakness
44.  unusual weight gain or loss
45.  vomiting
46.  vomiting of blood or material that looks like coffee grounds
47.  yellow eyes or skin

【79】#### Incidence not known

【80】1.  Blistering, peeling, or loosening of the skin
2.  change in consciousness
3.  confusion as to time, place, or person
4.  cracks in the skin
5.  darkening of the skin
6.  depression
7.  dry mouth
8.  fainting
9.  hallucinations
10.  holding false beliefs that cannot be changed by fact
11.  loss of consciousness
12.  loss of heat from the body
13.  pain in the lower back or side
14.  pain in the chest, groin, or legs, especially calves of the legs
15.  red skin lesions, often with a purple center
16.  red, irritated eyes
17.  red, swollen skin
18.  scaly skin
19.  seizures
20.  severe headaches of sudden onset
21.  sores, ulcers, or white spots in the mouth or on the lips
22.  stiff neck or back
23.  sudden loss of coordination
24.  sudden onset of slurred speech
25.  sudden vision changes
26.  swollen glands
27.  thirst
28.  unusual excitement, nervousness, or restlessness

【81】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【82】#### Less common

【83】1.  Back pain
2.  belching
3.  body aches or pain
4.  cough producing mucus
5.  difficulty having a bowel movement
6.  difficulty with moving
7.  ear congestion
8.  loss of voice
9.  muscle stiffness
10.  pain or tenderness around the eyes and cheekbones
11.  sneezing
12.  stuffy nose

【84】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【85】Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

【86】Portions of this document last updated: Aug. 01, 2023

【87】Original article: https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements/ibuprofen-and-famotidine-oral-route/description/drg-20074882

title: Highlights from the Current Issue – Audiovisual Summary

title: Fludarabine (Intravenous Route)
text:
【0】Fludarabine (Intravenous Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### Descriptions

【3】  

【4】Fludarabine injection belongs to the group of medicines called antimetabolites. It is used to treat a type of cancer of the white blood cells called B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL). This medicine is used in patients with CLL who have already been treated with an alkylating agent (e.g., bendamustine) that did not work well. .

【5】Fludarabine injection interferes with the growth of cancer cells, which are eventually destroyed. Since the growth of normal body cells may also be affected by fludarabine injection, other effects may also occur. Some of these may be serious and must be reported to your doctor. Other effects may not be serious but may cause concern. Some effects may not occur for months or years after the medicine is used.

【6】Before you begin treatment with fludarabine injection, you and your doctor should talk about the good this medicine will do as well as the risks of using it.

【7】Fludarabine injection is to be administered only by or under the immediate supervision of your doctor.

【8】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【9】*   Powder for Solution
*   Solution

【10】Before Using
------------

【11】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【12】### Allergies

【13】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【14】### Pediatric

【15】Appropriate studies have not been performed on the relationship of age to the effects of fludarabine injection in the pediatric population. Safety and efficacy have not been established.

【16】### Geriatric

【17】No information is available on the relationship of age to the effects of fludarabine injection in geriatric patients.

【18】### Breastfeeding

【19】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【20】### Drug Interactions

【21】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are receiving this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【22】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【23】*   Measles Virus Vaccine, Live
*   Mumps Virus Vaccine, Live
*   Rotavirus Vaccine, Live
*   Rubella Virus Vaccine, Live
*   Varicella Virus Vaccine, Live
*   Zoster Vaccine, Live

【24】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【25】*   Adenovirus Vaccine
*   Bacillus of Calmette and Guerin Vaccine, Live
*   Cholera Vaccine, Live
*   Dengue Tetravalent Vaccine, Live
*   Influenza Virus Vaccine, Live
*   Pentostatin
*   Poliovirus Vaccine, Live
*   Smallpox Vaccine
*   Typhoid Vaccine, Live
*   Yellow Fever Vaccine

【26】### Other Interactions

【27】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【28】### Other Medical Problems

【29】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【30】*   Bone marrow problems (e.g., anemia, neutropenia, or thrombocytopenia)—Fludarabine injection may worsen these conditions.

【31】*   Chickenpox (including recent exposure) or
*   Herpes zoster (shingles)—Risk of severe disease affecting other parts of the body.

【32】*   Gout (history of) or
*   Kidney stones (history of)—Fludarabine may increase levels of uric acid in the body, which can cause gout or kidney stones.

【33】*   Infection—Fludarabine injection may decrease your body's ability to fight infection.

【34】*   Kidney disease—Use with caution. Effects of fludarabine injection may be increased because of slower removal of the medicine from the body.

【35】*   Transfusions—Non-irradiated blood transfusion may increase the risk of side effects of fludarabine injection.

【36】Proper Use
----------

【37】This medicine may cause nausea and vomiting. However, it is very important that you continue to receive the medicine even if you begin to feel ill. Ask your doctor for ways to lessen these effects.

【38】You will receive this medicine while you are in a hospital or cancer treatment center. A nurse or other trained health professional will give you this medicine.

【39】This medicine is given through a needle placed in one of your veins. It is usually given every day for 5 days. This 5-day treatment is given again every 28 days until your body responds to the medicine. Each treatment usually takes about 30 minutes.

【40】Precautions
-----------

【41】It is very important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits to make sure that this medicine is working properly. Blood tests may be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【42】While you are being treated with fludarabine injection, and after you stop treatment with it, do not have any immunizations (vaccinations) without your doctor's approval. Fludarabine injection may lower your body's resistance and there is a chance you might get the infection the immunization is meant to prevent. In addition, other persons living in your household should not take oral polio vaccine since there is a chance they could pass the polio virus on to you. Also, avoid persons who have recently taken oral polio vaccine. Do not get close to them and do not stay in the same room with them for very long. If you cannot take these precautions, you should consider wearing a protective face mask that covers the nose and mouth.

【43】Fludarabine injection can temporarily lower the number of white blood cells in your blood, increasing the chance of getting an infection (e.g. pneumonia). It can also lower the number of platelets, which are necessary for proper blood clotting. If this occurs, there are certain precautions you can take, especially when your blood count is low, to reduce the risk of infection or bleeding:

【44】*   If you can, avoid people with infections. Check with your doctor immediately if you think you are getting an infection or if you have fever or chills, cough or hoarseness, lower back or side pain, painful or difficult urination; shortness of breath; or unusual bleeding or bruising.
*   Check with your doctor immediately if you notice any unusual bleeding or bruising; black, tarry stools; blood in the urine or stools; or pinpoint red spots on your skin.
*   Be careful when using a regular toothbrush, dental floss, or toothpick. Your medical doctor, dentist, or nurse may recommend other ways to clean your teeth and gums. Check with your medical doctor before having any dental work done.
*   Do not touch your eyes or the inside of your nose unless you have just washed your hands and have not touched anything else in the meantime.
*   Be careful not to cut yourself when you are using sharp objects such as a safety razor or fingernail or toenail cutters.
*   Avoid contact sports or other situations where bruising or injury could occur.

【45】You should not use this medicine if you are also taking pentostatin (Nipent®). Taking it together with this medicine may increase the chance of serious side effect.

【46】This medicine may cause a serious type of reaction called tumor lysis syndrome. Your doctor may give you a medicine to help prevent this. Call your doctor right away if you have a decrease or change in urine amount; joint pain, stiffness, or swelling; lower back, side, or stomach pain; a rapid weight gain; swelling of the feet or lower legs; or unusual tiredness or weakness.

【47】Using this medicine while you are pregnant can harm your unborn baby. Use an effective form of birth control to keep from getting pregnant. You should not become pregnant while you are taking this medicine and for 6 months after stopping it. If you think you have become pregnant while using the medicine, tell your doctor right away.

【48】This medicine may cause unusual weakness, trouble in thinking, or trouble in seeing clearly. Make sure you know how you react to this medicine before you drive, use machines, or do other jobs that require you to be alert, well-coordinated, or able to think or see well.

【49】Side Effects
------------

【50】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【51】Check with your doctor or nurse immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【52】#### More common

【53】1.  Arm, back, or jaw pain
2.  black, tarry stools
3.  blood in the urine or stools
4.  chest pain or discomfort
5.  chest tightness or heaviness
6.  constipation
7.  cough or hoarseness
8.  coughing or spitting up blood
9.  fast or irregular heartbeat
10.  fever or chills
11.  general feeling of discomfort or illness
12.  lower back or side pain
13.  nausea
14.  pain
15.  painful, burning, or difficult urination
16.  pale skin
17.  pinpoint red spots on the skin
18.  shortness of breath
19.  sneezing
20.  sore throat
21.  sores, ulcers, or white spots on the lips or in the mouth
22.  stomach pain, severe
23.  sweating
24.  swelling
25.  tender, swollen glands in the neck
26.  thickening of bronchial secretions
27.  troubled breathing
28.  unusual bleeding or bruising
29.  unusual tiredness or weakness
30.  vomiting of blood or material that looks like coffee grounds
31.  wheezing

【54】#### Less common

【55】1.  Agitation
2.  aneurysm
3.  bleeding gums
4.  blurred vision
5.  confusion
6.  decreased urine output
7.  difficulty in breathing or swallowing
8.  dilated neck veins
9.  dizziness
10.  extreme fatigue
11.  fainting
12.  fast, pounding, or irregular heartbeat or pulse
13.  headache
14.  increased menstrual flow or vaginal bleeding
15.  irregular breathing
16.  loss of hearing
17.  nosebleeds
18.  numbness or tingling in the fingers, toes, or face
19.  pain, redness, or swelling in the arm or leg
20.  paralysis
21.  prolonged bleeding from cuts
22.  seizures
23.  slurred speech
24.  sudden and severe inability to speak
25.  temporary blindness
26.  weakness in the arm or leg on one side of the body, sudden and severe
27.  weight gain

【56】#### Rare

【57】1.  Blindness
2.  continuing vomiting
3.  dark-colored urine
4.  drowsiness
5.  frequent urination
6.  hives
7.  itching
8.  light-colored stools
9.  loss of appetite
10.  loss of consciousness
11.  lower abdominal cramping
12.  muscle tremors
13.  puffiness or swelling of the eyelids or around the eyes, face, lips, or tongue
14.  rapid, deep breathing
15.  restlessness
16.  skin rash
17.  stomach pain
18.  trouble speaking, thinking, or walking
19.  yellow eyes or skin

【58】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【59】#### More common

【60】1.  Abdominal pain
2.  bladder pain
3.  body aches or pain
4.  burning, crawling, itching, numbness, prickling, “pins and needles”, or tingling feelings
5.  cloudy urine
6.  congestion
7.  diarrhea
8.  difficulty in moving
9.  dry mouth or throat
10.  flushed, dry skin
11.  frequent urge to urinate
12.  fruit-like breath odor
13.  increased hunger
14.  increased thirst
15.  increased urination
16.  joint pain
17.  muscle aching or cramping
18.  muscle pains or stiffness
19.  runny nose
20.  swollen joints
21.  trouble in swallowing
22.  voice changes
23.  weight loss

【61】#### Less common

【62】1.  Abdominal fullness
2.  bluish color of skin
3.  changes in skin color
4.  cracked lips
5.  dandruff
6.  decrease in height
7.  decreased urination
8.  difficulty in sleeping
9.  discouragement
10.  feeling sad or empty
11.  gaseous abdominal pain
12.  heartburn
13.  irritability
14.  loss of interest or pleasure
15.  lightheadedness
16.  oily skin
17.  pain or tenderness around the eyes and cheekbones
18.  rapid breathing
19.  recurrent fever
20.  stuffy nose
21.  sunken eye
22.  trouble concentrating
23.  wrinkled skin

【63】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【64】Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

【65】Portions of this document last updated: Feb. 01, 2023

title: Tranexamic Acid (Intravenous Route)
text:
【0】Tranexamic Acid (Intravenous Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Cyklokapron

【4】### Descriptions

【5】  

【6】Tranexamic acid injection is used to control or prevent excessive or heavy bleeding during dental procedures in patients with hemophilia.

【7】Tranexamic acid injection is an antifibrinolytic agent. It works by blocking the breakdown of blood clots. It may also be used for other conditions as determined by your doctor.

【8】This medicine is to be given only by or under the direct supervision of your doctor.

【9】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【10】*   Solution

【11】Before Using
------------

【12】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【13】### Allergies

【14】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【15】### Pediatric

【16】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated pediatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of tranexamic acid injection in the pediatric population.

【17】### Geriatric

【18】Appropriate studies performed to date have not demonstrated geriatric-specific problems that would limit the usefulness of tranexamic acid injection in the elderly. However, elderly patients are more likely to have age-related kidney problems, which may require caution for patients receiving this medicine.

【19】### Breastfeeding

【20】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【21】### Drug Interactions

【22】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are receiving this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【23】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【24】*   Desogestrel
*   Dienogest
*   Drospirenone
*   Estradiol
*   Ethinyl Estradiol
*   Ethynodiol
*   Etonogestrel
*   Gestodene
*   Levonorgestrel
*   Medroxyprogesterone
*   Mestranol
*   Nomegestrol
*   Norelgestromin
*   Norethindrone
*   Norgestimate
*   Norgestrel
*   Segesterone
*   Ulipristal

【25】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【26】*   Anti-Inhibitor Coagulant Complex
*   Chlorpromazine
*   Tretinoin

【27】### Other Interactions

【28】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【29】### Other Medical Problems

【30】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【31】*   Blood clots, active or
*   Subarachnoid hemorrhage (bleeding in the brain)—Should not be used in patients with these conditions.

【32】*   Eye or vision problems or
*   Seizures, history of—Use with caution. May make these conditions worse.

【33】*   Kidney disease—Use with caution. The effects may be increased because of slower removal of the medicine from the body.

【34】Proper Use
----------

【35】A nurse or other trained health professional will give you this medicine in a medical facility. It is given through a needle placed into one of your veins. This medicine is for short-term use only, usually 2 to 8 days.

【36】Precautions
-----------

【37】It is very important that your doctor check your or your child's progress closely while you are receiving this medicine to make sure this medicine is working properly and to decide if you should continue to receive it. Blood and urine tests may be needed to check for unwanted effects.

【38】This medicine may increase your or your child's risk of developing blood clots. Check with your doctor right away if you or your child have swelling and pain in your arms, legs, or stomach, chest pain, trouble breathing, loss of sensation, confusion, or problems with muscle control or speech.

【39】Receiving this medicine together with birth control pills may also increase your risk of developing blood clots. Use another form of birth control (including condoms, spermicide) to keep from getting pregnant.

【40】This medicine may increase your risk for seizures. This risk may more likely to occur if you are having a surgery for a heart or blood vessel problem. Talk to your doctor if you have any concerns.

【41】This medicine may cause a serious allergic reaction, called anaphylaxis, which can be life-threatening and requires immediate medical attention. Tell your doctor right away if you have a rash, itching, hoarseness, trouble breathing or swallowing, or any swelling of your hands, face, or mouth after receiving this medicine.

【42】If you or your child will be receiving tranexamic acid injection for longer than several days, your doctor may want you to have your eyes checked regularly by an ophthalmologist (eye doctor). Blurred vision, difficulty with reading, or any other change in vision may occur during or after treatment this medicine.

【43】This medicine may make you dizzy. Do not drive or do anything else that could be dangerous until you know how this medicine affects you.

【44】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This includes prescription or non-prescription (over-the-counter \[OTC\]) medicines and herbal or vitamin supplements.

【45】Side Effects
------------

【46】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【47】Check with your doctor or nurse immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【48】#### Incidence not known

【49】1.  Anxiety
2.  bloody or cloudy urine
3.  blurred or loss of vision
4.  changes in vision
5.  chest pain or tightness
6.  confusion
7.  cough
8.  difficult or painful urination
9.  difficulty swallowing
10.  disturbed color perception
11.  dizziness, fainting, or lightheadedness when getting up suddenly from a lying or sitting position
12.  double vision
13.  fast heartbeat
14.  halos around lights
15.  hives, itching, skin rash
16.  migraine headache
17.  night blindness
18.  numbness of the hands
19.  overbright appearance of lights
20.  pain, redness, or swelling in the arm or leg
21.  puffiness or swelling of the eyelids or around the eyes, face, lips, or tongue
22.  redness of the skin
23.  seizures
24.  sudden decrease in the amount of urine
25.  sweating
26.  trouble breathing
27.  tunnel vision
28.  unusual tiredness or weakness

【50】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【51】#### Incidence not known

【52】1.  Bleeding, blistering, burning, coldness, discoloration of the skin, feeling of pressure, hives, infection, inflammation, itching, lumps, numbness, pain, rash, redness, scarring, soreness, stinging, swelling, tenderness, tingling, ulceration, or warmth at injection site
2.  diarrhea
3.  giddiness
4.  nausea
5.  vomiting

【53】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【54】Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

【55】Portions of this document last updated: Aug. 01, 2023

【56】Original article: https://www.mayoclinic.org/drugs-supplements/tranexamic-acid-intravenous-route/description/drg-20072465

title: Methyldopa And Hydrochlorothiazide (Oral Route)
text:
【0】Methyldopa And Hydrochlorothiazide (Oral Route)
Description and Brand Names
---------------------------

【1】Drug information provided by: Merative, Micromedex®

【2】### US Brand Name

【3】1.  Aldoril

【4】### Descriptions

【5】  

【6】Methyldopa and hydrochlorothiazide combination is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension).

【7】High blood pressure adds to the workload of the heart and arteries. If it continues for a long time, the heart and arteries may not function properly. This can damage the blood vessels of the brain, heart, and kidneys, resulting in a stroke, heart failure, or kidney failure. High blood pressure may also increase the risk of heart attacks. These problems may be less likely to occur if blood pressure is controlled.

【8】Methyldopa works by controlling nerve impulses along certain nerve pathways. As a result, it relaxes blood vessels so that blood passes through them more easily. Hydrochlorothiazide helps reduce the amount of water in the body by increasing the flow of urine. These actions help to lower blood pressure.

【9】This medicine is available only with your doctor's prescription.

【10】This product is available in the following dosage forms:

【11】*   Tablet

【12】Before Using
------------

【13】In deciding to use a medicine, the risks of taking the medicine must be weighed against the good it will do. This is a decision you and your doctor will make. For this medicine, the following should be considered:

【14】### Allergies

【15】Tell your doctor if you have ever had any unusual or allergic reaction to this medicine or any other medicines. Also tell your health care professional if you have any other types of allergies, such as to foods, dyes, preservatives, or animals. For non-prescription products, read the label or package ingredients carefully.

【16】### Pediatric

【17】Although there is no specific information comparing use of this medicine in children with use in other age groups, it is not expected to cause different side effects or problems in children than it does in adults.

【18】### Geriatric

【19】Dizziness or light-headedness, drowsiness, or signs of too much potassium loss may be more likely to occur in the elderly, who are more sensitive to the effects of methyldopa and hydrochlorothiazide.

【20】### Breastfeeding

【21】Hydrochlorothiazide

【22】There are no adequate studies in women for determining infant risk when using this medication during breastfeeding. Weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks before taking this medication while breastfeeding.

【23】Methyldopa

【24】Studies in women suggest that this medication poses minimal risk to the infant when used during breastfeeding.

【25】### Drug Interactions

【26】Although certain medicines should not be used together at all, in other cases two different medicines may be used together even if an interaction might occur. In these cases, your doctor may want to change the dose, or other precautions may be necessary. When you are taking this medicine, it is especially important that your healthcare professional know if you are taking any of the medicines listed below. The following interactions have been selected on the basis of their potential significance and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

【27】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is not recommended. Your doctor may decide not to treat you with this medication or change some of the other medicines you take.

【28】*   Brofaromine
*   Clorgyline
*   Dofetilide
*   Furazolidone
*   Iproniazid
*   Isocarboxazid
*   Lazabemide
*   Linezolid
*   Moclobemide
*   Nialamide
*   Pargyline
*   Phenelzine
*   Procarbazine
*   Rasagiline
*   Selegiline
*   Toloxatone
*   Tranylcypromine

【29】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines is usually not recommended, but may be required in some cases. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【30】*   Acarbose
*   Aceclofenac
*   Acemetacin
*   Acetyldigoxin
*   Albiglutide
*   Albuterol
*   Alogliptin
*   Amphetamine
*   Amtolmetin Guacil
*   Arsenic Trioxide
*   Aspirin
*   Benzphetamine
*   Bromfenac
*   Bromocriptine
*   Bufexamac
*   Buprenorphine
*   Canagliflozin
*   Celecoxib
*   Chlorpropamide
*   Choline Salicylate
*   Clonixin
*   Codeine
*   Dapagliflozin
*   Deslanoside
*   Desmopressin
*   Dexibuprofen
*   Dexketoprofen
*   Dextroamphetamine
*   Diclofenac
*   Diflunisal
*   Digitalis
*   Digitoxin
*   Digoxin
*   Dipyrone
*   Droperidol
*   Droxicam
*   Dulaglutide
*   Empagliflozin
*   Entacapone

*   Etoricoxib

*   Insulin Bovine

*   Iobenguane I 131
*   Ketanserin
*   Ketoprofen
*   Ketorolac
*   Levomethadyl
*   Linagliptin
*   Liraglutide
*   Lisdexamfetamine
*   Lithium
*   Lixisenatide

*   Mefenamic Acid
*   Meloxicam

【31】Using this medicine with any of the following medicines may cause an increased risk of certain side effects, but using both drugs may be the best treatment for you. If both medicines are prescribed together, your doctor may change the dose or how often you use one or both of the medicines.

【32】*   Alprenolol
*   Aminolevulinic Acid
*   Bepridil
*   Bisoprolol
*   Carbamazepine
*   Cholestyramine
*   Ferric Ammonium Citrate
*   Ginkgo
*   Gossypol
*   Haloperidol
*   Iron
*   Licorice
*   Phenylpropanolamine
*   Sotalol
*   Timolol

【33】### Other Interactions

【34】Certain medicines should not be used at or around the time of eating food or eating certain types of food since interactions may occur. Using alcohol or tobacco with certain medicines may also cause interactions to occur. Discuss with your healthcare professional the use of your medicine with food, alcohol, or tobacco.

【35】### Other Medical Problems

【36】The presence of other medical problems may affect the use of this medicine. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially:

【37】*   Angina (chest pain)—Methyldopa may worsen the condition.

【38】*   Type 2 diabetes mellitus—Hydrochlorothiazide may change the amount of diabetes medicine needed.

【39】*   Gout (history of)—Hydrochlorothiazide may increase the amount of uric acid in the blood, which can lead to gout.

【40】*   High cholesterol—Hydrochlorothiazide may raise cholesterol levels.

【41】*   Kidney disease—Effects of methyldopa and hydrochlorothiazide may be increased because of slower removal from the body. If severe, hydrochlorothiazide may not work.

【42】*   Liver disease—Effects of methyldopa may be increased because of slower removal from the body. If hydrochlorothiazide causes loss of too much water from the body, liver disease can become much worse.

【43】*   Lupus erythematosus (history of)—Hydrochlorothiazide may worsen the condition.

【44】*   Mental depression (history of)—Methyldopa can cause mental depression
*   Pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas)
*   Parkinson's disease—Methyldopa may worsen the condition.
*   Pheochromocytoma—Methyldopa may interfere with tests for the condition. In addition, there have been reports of increased blood pressure.

【45】Proper Use
----------

【46】In addition to the use of the medicine your doctor has prescribed, appropriate treatment for your high blood pressure may include weight control and care in the types of foods you eat, especially foods high in sodium. Your doctor will tell you which factors are most important for you. You should check with your doctor before changing your diet.

【47】Many patients who have high blood pressure will not notice any signs of the problem. In fact, many may feel normal. It is very important that you take your medicine exactly as directed and that you keep your appointments with your doctor even if you feel well.

【48】Remember that this medicine will not cure your high blood pressure but it does help control it. Therefore, you must continue to take it as directed if you expect to lower your blood pressure and keep it down. You may have to take high blood pressure medicine for the rest of your life. If high blood pressure is not treated, it can cause serious problems such as heart failure, blood vessel disease, stroke, or kidney disease.

【49】This medicine may cause you to have an unusual feeling of tiredness when you begin to take it. You may also notice an increase in the amount of urine or in your frequency of urination. After taking the medicine for a while, these effects should lessen. In general, to keep the increase in urine from affecting your sleep:

【50】*   If you are to take a single dose a day, take it in the morning after breakfast.
*   If you are to take more than one dose a day, take the last dose no later than 6 p.m., unless otherwise directed by your doctor.

【51】However, it is best to plan your dose or doses according to a schedule that will least affect your personal activities and sleep. Ask your health care professional to help you plan the best time to take this medicine.

【52】To help you remember to take your medicine, try to get into the habit of taking it at the same time each day.

【53】### Dosing

【54】The dose of this medicine will be different for different patients. Follow your doctor's orders or the directions on the label. The following information includes only the average doses of this medicine. If your dose is different, do not change it unless your doctor tells you to do so.

【55】The amount of medicine that you take depends on the strength of the medicine. Also, the number of doses you take each day, the time allowed between doses, and the length of time you take the medicine depend on the medical problem for which you are using the medicine.

【56】*   For treating high blood pressure:
    *   For oral dosage form (tablets):
        *   Adults: Two to four tablets a day, taken as a single dose or in divided doses.
        *   Children: Dose must be determined by your doctor.

【57】### Missed Dose

【58】If you miss a dose of this medicine, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not double doses.

【59】### Storage

【60】Keep out of the reach of children.

【61】Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep from freezing.

【62】Do not keep outdated medicine or medicine no longer needed.

【63】Precautions
-----------

【64】It is important that your doctor check your progress at regular visits to make sure that this medicine is working properly.

【65】Do not take other medicines unless they have been discussed with your doctor. This especially includes over-the-counter (nonprescription) medicines for appetite control, asthma, colds, cough, hay fever, or sinus problems, since they may tend to increase your blood pressure.

【66】This medicine may cause a loss of potassium from your body:

【67】*   To help prevent this, your doctor may want you to:
    *   eat or drink foods that have a high potassium content (for example, orange or other citrus fruit juices), or
    *   take a potassium supplement, or
    *   take another medicine to help prevent the loss of the potassium in the first place.
*   It is very important to follow these directions. Also, it is important not to change your diet on your own. This is more important if you are already on a special diet (as for diabetes), or if you are taking a potassium supplement or a medicine to reduce potassium loss. Extra potassium may not be necessary and, in some cases, too much potassium could be harmful.

【68】Check with your doctor if you become sick and have severe or continuing vomiting or diarrhea. These problems may cause you to lose additional water and potassium.

【69】Before having any kind of surgery (including dental surgery) or emergency treatment, tell the medical doctor or dentist in charge that you are taking this medicine.

【70】If you have a fever and there seems to be no reason for it, check with your doctor. This is especially important during the first few weeks you take this medicine since fever may be a sign of a serious reaction to methyldopa.

【71】This medicine may cause some people to become drowsy or less alert than they are normally. This is more likely to happen when you begin to take it or when you increase the amount of medicine you are taking. Make sure you know how you react to this medicine before you drive, use machines, or do anything else that could be dangerous if you are not alert.

【72】Dizziness, light-headedness, or fainting may occur, especially when you get up from a lying or sitting position. Getting up slowly may help, but if the problem continues or gets worse, check with your doctor.

【73】The dizziness, light-headedness, or fainting is also more likely to occur if you drink alcohol, stand for long periods of time, exercise, or if the weather is hot. Drinking alcoholic beverages may also make the drowsiness worse. While you are taking this medicine, be careful in the amount of alcohol you drink. Also, use extra care during exercise or hot weather or if you must stand for long periods of time.

【74】For diabetic patients:

【75】*   This medicine may raise blood sugar levels. While you are using this medicine, be especially careful in testing for sugar in your urine. If you have any questions about this, check with your doctor.

【76】This medicine may cause dryness of the mouth. For temporary relief, use sugarless candy or gum, melt bits of ice in your mouth, or use a saliva substitute. However, if your mouth continues to feel dry for more than 2 weeks, check with your medical doctor or dentist. Continuing dryness of the mouth may increase the chance of dental disease, including tooth decay, gum disease, and fungus infections.

【77】Hydrochlorothiazide may cause your skin to be more sensitive to sunlight than it is normally. Exposure to sunlight, even for brief periods of time, may cause a skin rash, itching, redness or other discoloration of the skin, or a severe sunburn. When you begin taking this medicine:

【78】*   Stay out of direct sunlight, especially between the hours of 10:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m., if possible.
*   Wear protective clothing, including a hat. Also, wear sunglasses.
*   Apply a sun block product that has a skin protection factor (SPF) of at least 15. Some patients may require a product with a higher SPF number, especially if they have a fair complexion. If you have any questions about this, check with your health care professional.
*   Apply a sun block lipstick that has an SPF of at least 15 to protect your lips.
*   Do not use a sunlamp or tanning bed or booth.

【79】If you have a severe reaction from the sun, check with your doctor

【80】Before you have any medical tests, tell the doctor in charge that you are taking this medicine. The results of some tests may be affected by this medicine.

【81】Side Effects
------------

【82】Along with its needed effects, a medicine may cause some unwanted effects. Although not all of these side effects may occur, if they do occur they may need medical attention.

【83】Check with your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

【84】#### Rare

【85】1.  Unexplained fever shortly after starting to take this medicine

【86】Check with your doctor as soon as possible if any of the following side effects occur:

【87】#### Signs and symptoms of too much potassium loss

【88】1.  Dry mouth
2.  increased thirst
3.  irregular heartbeats
4.  muscle cramps or pain
5.  nausea or vomiting
6.  unusual tiredness or weakness
7.  weak pulse

【89】#### Less common

【90】1.  Mental depression or anxiety
2.  nightmares or unusually vivid dreams

【91】#### Rare

【92】1.  Cough or hoarseness
2.  dark or amber urine
3.  diarrhea or stomach cramps (severe or continuing)
4.  fever, chills, troubled breathing, and fast heartbeat
5.  general feeling of discomfort or illness or weakness
6.  joint pain
7.  lower back or side pain
8.  painful or difficult urination
9.  pale stools
10.  skin rash, hives, or itching
11.  stomach pain (severe) with nausea and vomiting
12.  tiredness or weakness after having taken this medicine for several weeks (continuing)
13.  yellow eyes or skin

【93】Some side effects may occur that usually do not need medical attention. These side effects may go away during treatment as your body adjusts to the medicine. Also, your health care professional may be able to tell you about ways to prevent or reduce some of these side effects. Check with your health care professional if any of the following side effects continue or are bothersome or if you have any questions about them:

【94】#### More common

【95】1.  Dizziness or light-headedness when getting up from a lying or sitting position
2.  drowsiness
3.  dryness of mouth
4.  headache

【96】#### Less common

【97】1.  Decreased sexual ability or interest in sex
2.  diarrhea
3.  increased sensitivity of skin to sunlight (skin rash, itching, redness or other discoloration of skin or severe sunburn after exposure to sunlight)
4.  loss of appetite
5.  numbness, tingling, pain, or weakness in hands or feet
6.  slow heartbeat
7.  stuffy nose
8.  swelling of breasts or unusual milk production

【98】Other side effects not listed may also occur in some patients. If you notice any other effects, check with your healthcare professional.

【99】Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

title: Cancer History Portends Worse Acute and Long-term Noncardiac (but Not Cardiac) Mortality After Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for Acute ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction
text:
【0】Cancer History Portends Worse Acute and Long-term Noncardiac (but Not Cardiac) Mortality After Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for Acute ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction
Abstract
--------

【1】### Objective

【2】To define the effect of a history of cancer on in-hospital and long-term mortality after primary percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) for ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI).

【3】### Patients and Methods

【4】In this retrospective cohort study of 2346 patients with STEMI enrolled in the Mayo Clinic PCI registry from November 1, 2000, through October 31, 2010, we identified 261 patients (11.1%) with a history of cancer. The in-hospital and long-term outcomes (median follow-up, 6.2 years; interquartile range=4.3-8.5 years), including cardiac and noncardiac death and heart failure hospitalization, of these patients were compared with those of 1313 cancer-negative patients matched on age, sex, family history of coronary artery disease, and date of STEMI.

【5】### Results

【6】Patients with cancer had higher in-hospital noncardiac (1.9% vs 0.4%; _P_ \=.03) but similar cardiac (5.8% vs 4.6%; _P_ \=.37) mortality as matched controls. The group at highest acute mortality risk were those diagnosed as having cancer within 6 months before STEMI (hazard ratio \[HR\]=7.0; 95% CI, 1.4-34.4; _P_ \=.02). At 5 years, patients with cancer had similar cardiac mortality (4.2% vs 5.8%; HR=1.27; 95% CI, 0.77-2.10; _P_ \=.35) despite more heart failure hospitalizations (15% vs 10%; HR=1.72; 95% CI, 1.18-2.50; _P_ \=.01) but faced higher noncardiac mortality (30.0% vs 11.0%; HR=3.01; 95% CI, 2.33-3.88; _P_ <.001) than controls, attributable solely to cancer-related deaths.

【7】### Conclusion

【8】One in 10 patients in this contemporary registry of patients undergoing primary PCI for STEMI has a history of cancer. These patients have more than a 3 times higher acute in-hospital and long-term noncardiac mortality risk but no increased acute or long-term cardiac mortality risk with guideline-recommended cardiac care.

【9】#### Abbreviations and Acronyms:

【10】ACS ( acute coronary syndrome ), AMI ( acute myocardial infarction ), CABG ( coronary artery bypass grafting ), CAD ( coronary artery disease ), CHF ( chronic heart failure ), COPD ( chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ), CVA ( cerebrovascular accident ), DES ( drug-eluting stent ), GP ( glycoprotein ), HR ( hazard ratio ), IABP ( intra-aortic balloon pump ), LAD ( left anterior descending artery ), LCX ( left circumflex artery ), LMA ( left main artery ), LVEF ( left ventricular ejection fraction ), MI ( myocardial infarction ), NA ( not available ), PCI ( percutaneous coronary intervention ), RCA ( right coronary artery ), STEMI ( ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction ), TIA ( transient ischemic attack ), TIMI ( Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction )

title: Association Between Payments by Pharmaceutical Manufacturers and Prescribing Behavior in Rheumatology
text:
【0】Association Between Payments by Pharmaceutical Manufacturers and Prescribing Behavior in Rheumatology
Abstract
--------

【1】### Objective

【2】To evaluate the association between pharmaceutical industry payments to rheumatologists and their prescribing behaviors.

【3】### Methods

【4】A cross-sectional analysis was conducted of Medicare Part B Public Use File, Medicare Part D Public Use File, and Open Payments data for 2013 to 2015. Prescription drugs responsible for 80% of the total Medicare pharmaceutical expenditures in rheumatology were analyzed. We calculated the mean annual drug cost per beneficiary per year, the percentage of rheumatologists who received payments, and the median annual payment per physician per drug per year. Industry payments were categorized as food/beverage and consulting/compensation. Multivariable regression models were used to assess associations between industry payments and both prescribing patterns and prescription drug expenditures.

【5】### Results

【6】Of 4822 rheumatologists in the Medicare prescribing databases, 3729 received any payment from a pharmaceutical company during this time frame. Food/beverage payments were associated with an increased proportion of prescriptions for the related drugs (range, 1.5% to 4.5%) and an increased proportion of annual Medicare spending for the related drugs (range, 3% to 23%). For every $100 in food/beverage payments, the probability of prescribing increased (range, 1.5% to 14% for most drugs) and Medicare reimbursements increased (range, 6% to 44% for most drugs). Consulting/compensation payments were associated with an increased proportion of prescriptions (range, 1.2% to 1.6%) and an increased proportion of annual Medicare spending (range, 1% to 2%). For every $1000 in consulting/compensation payments, both the probability of prescribing increased (5% or less for most drugs) and Medicare reimbursements increased (less than 10% for most drugs).

【7】### Conclusion

【8】Payments to rheumatologists by pharmaceutical companies are associated with increased probability of prescribing and Medicare spending.

【9】#### Abbreviations and Acronyms:

【10】CMS ( Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services ), NPI ( National Provider Identifier ), PUF ( Public Use File ), rACTH ( repository corticotropin )
